intro: Hieracium zlatnikii, commonly known as the Zlatnik hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
